A remarkably unique detached home in a wonderfully peaceful position close to Pittville Park. Initially unassuming and set back from the road, the property measures in excess of 2,000sq.ft. and includes four generous double bedrooms and beautifully proportioned living accommodation.
A stunning detached family residence in one of Cheltenham’s most sought after districts.

In an elevated position affording stunning views across open fields toward the Cotswold escarpment, this very well presented and substantial detached family home dates from the late 1970’s and has been owned by the same family who have meticulously cared for it over the last 28 years.

Completely renovated by a highly regarded local builder, this Grade II Listed townhouse has its accommodation arranged over four floors and is presented to exemplary standards. With secure off road parking and a pretty town garden there is also potential for a self-contained apartment.

This impressive and substantial five bedroom detached property is set back from the road with a generous garden and countryside views. Requiring some updating in places, this bright and spacious home would be well suited to family life with a covered swimming pool, double garage and off road parking. No onward chain.

This beautifully appointed and spacious detached home was constructed in 2008 and has been designed in a contemporary style with heavily glazed elevations. Boasting five double bedrooms and three bathrooms together with off road parking and generous private gardens in popular Charlton Kings.

Standing close to the top of Cleeve Hill and enjoying distant views across the Severn Vale, The Pines is a substantial detached family home offering five bedrooms and a choice of reception rooms, set well back from the road in a near one acre plot, within a short drive of both Winchcombe and Cheltenham.

Backing onto open countryside, this imposing and detached home was formerly used in the preparation of butter and dates back to approximately 1730. Enjoying particularly generous proportions and beautiful gardens backing onto open countryside, this charming property offers significant scope to improve.

This beautifully presented end terrace family home has been extensively renovated to provide four bedrooms, two bathrooms and spacious living accommodation. Within a short walk of popular Bath Road, this home is within the catchment areas for Leckhampton and Naunton Park Primary Schools.

Situated towards the end of one of Cheltenham’s most desirable no through roads, this deceptively spacious detached single storey dwelling boasts light and versatile accommodation approaching 2,000 sq.ft. including four bedrooms, a double garage and driveway for a number of vehicles.

A rare opportunity to acquire an attractive neo Georgian detached family house set within this quiet and established no through road. The well-presented accommodation which is arranged over two floors flows well and is of generous proportions and now requires a modicum of upgrading.

Standing in this quiet, established residential no through road, this is a charming and substantial semi-detached house dating from the 1930’s. In need of a sympathetic programme of restoration, Roman Hackle is set in a stunning South facing garden sloping down to the River Chelt.

This individual detached residence was constructed and finished to exacting standards by the present owners. With accommodation approaching 3,000 sq.ft., this particularly bright and spacious home also enjoys a double garage and generous off road parking all in an idyllic peaceful location.

Renovated and extended to exacting standards by the present owner, this bright and spacious semi-detached four bedroom Edwardian family home enjoys exemplary accommodation over three floors, off road parking for two cars and a good sized sunny garden with pedestrian side access.

Standing proud at the top of the escarpment enjoying far reaching views towards Cheltenham, this heavily extended and renovated four bedroom detached house offers character and charm throughout, spacious accommodation and paddocks and gardens extending to just under 1 acre.

An impressive detached family home originally dating from the 1930’s and retaining many of the character features typical of the era, complimented with an outstanding open plan kitchen/dining/sitting room at the rear of the property overlooking a Westerly enclosed garden.

This individual stone built family house dating from the late 1970’s has four bedrooms and two bathrooms and has been particularly well maintained and upgraded by the present owners. With beautiful gardens, garaging and off road parking, this property is located within walking distance of the village centre and enjoys beautiful views of Cleeve Hill.

Forming part of a pretty Victorian terrace on a quiet road on the edge of Charlton Kings, this charming period property is presented and finished to the highest standard having been thoughtfully extended by the present owners including a very smart master bedroom suite within the converted loft.

Situated within walking distance to Balcarras School, this large 1930’s semi-detached family home is in excellent order and offers generous accommodation over two floors. Full of features typical of the era including fireplaces and bow windows, the house and its sizeable gardens back onto Newcourt Park.

Probably one of the finest country houses to come to the market this year, set in its own stunning gardens and grounds of about 2 acres, standing at the foot of the escarpment, enjoying glorious views, yet only some 2½ miles to the centre of Cheltenham, Queenwood House is simply unique.

With a self-contained two bedroom apartment, this substantial end of terrace Grade II* Listed Regency town house has been the subject of a comprehensive programme of restoration by the present owners and retains a wealth of character features in the heart of Cheltenham.

Situated in a generous plot measuring approx. 1.8acres, this beautifully presented and very well proportioned detached family home has been thoughtfully renovated and is surrounded by open countryside in the idyllic and semi- rural village of Coberley, just 5 miles South of Cheltenham. The Rise also benefits from full planning consent for the erection of three holiday cottages within its beautiful

This substantial Cotswold Stone former Farmhouse dating from the 1600’s, boasts an enormous of amount of character features, including beamed ceilings, inglenook fireplaces and flagstone floors, standing on the edge of this small village located at the foot of Cleeve Hill.

One of the finest homes to come to the market this year. Constructed in 2013 and finished to exacting standards by the present owners, this civic award winning property offers practical and forward thinking living, pushing the boundaries of design and technological advances to create what is a stunning contemporary home.

A rare opportunity to purchase a detached bungalow with full planning consent for the erection of a stunning contemporary family home of some 7,000sq.ft. Affording far reaching views, ‘Sunnyhill’ is located on Stanley Road within the highly desirable Battledown Estate which is within walking distance of the town’s famous Promenade.

Created from the former Ryeworth Inn by the highly regarded local developer, Marcus Homes. This thoroughly renovated and extended detached house has the benefit of a 10 year CRL structural warranty, four generous bedrooms, three bathrooms and fantastic living accommodation on the ground floor.

Having undergone a sympathetic yet extensive extension and renovation by the present owners, this substantial four bedroom detached home offers bright and spacious accommodation nearing 2,500sq.ft. and enjoys three bath/shower rooms, a private garden, garage and off road parking.

A thoughtfully extended and renovated 1930’s semi-detached family home affording four bedrooms and spacious living accommodation, retaining many original character features, the property benefits from a garage, off road parking and a beautiful West facing private garden.

Probably one of the most extraordinary properties to come to the market in recent years. This outstanding duplex apartment measures c. 3,200sq.ft., boasts a stunning private garden of about 0.2acres and is within this beautiful Grade II listed Regency villa with a garage and off road parking in the heart of the Montpellier district.

Adjoining open fields and thus enjoying spectacular views towards the nearby Cotswold escarpment, this is a substantial detached family home, of some 2,800 Sq.ft. Dating from the 1970’s this property has been well maintained and offers well planned accommodation, set in a large mature garden.

Standing at the foot of the escarpment, enjoying stunning views over the fields towards the hill, this detached early 1970’s family house comes to the market for the first time since new, but would now benefit a general programme of refurbishment and possible enlargement.

This is a beautifully presented substantial country house, standing on the Gloucestershire/Worcestershire borders surrounded by its own stunning gardens and grounds in excess of 7 acres and enjoying unrivalled views over the surrounding rolling countryside.

Standing in the heart of Montpellier in a remarkably quiet location within a short walk of this districts well known boutiques, Montpellier Cottage, an absolute gem is set behind and electric gate and has been thoroughly restored by the present owners with outstanding attention to detail and imagination.

Standing near the end of this quiet no through road at the foot of Leckhampton Hill enjoying stunning views over open fields, this is a detached family house dating from the 1970’s, offered in good order, but would warrant a sympathetic programme of updating in places.

Designed and built by a reputable local developer, this brand new 4/5 bedroom family home has been finished to exacting standards, offering bright and spacious accommodation over three floors, a generous garden, stunning far reaching views to Leckhampton Hill and a new build guarantee.

Coming to the market for the first time since 1978, Newburn is an individual detached family house discreetly situated within established gardens behind a characterful redbrick wall affording peace and quiet and privacy within this sought after central location just a short walk from Montpellier.

In an outstanding, elevated location, just outside the highly regarded and sought after Cotswold village of Cowley, commanding breath taking views over spectacular Cotswold countryside, a substantial stone barn conversion offering excellent accommodation with a wealth of character.

A substantial mid Victorian detached family home set privately and back from the road behind red brick walling and electric gates. A spacious and versatile home, The poplars boasts 6/7 bedrooms, bright and spacious living accommodation and generous manicured gardens and grounds.
A brand new development of fourteen one and two bedroom apartments with off road parking.

Situated on one of Cheltenham’s most highly desired roads, this substantial early 1900’s detached family house affords excellent accommodation and a wealth of character, set in beautiful mature gardens.

A delightful, beautifully presented and substantially enlarged family home, set in this prestigious gated private development, created in the early 1990’s by Britannia Homes, now enjoying a quiet and mature environment, this executive house has been significantly upgraded by the present owners.

Originally the coach house to Park House, substantially enlarged in the 1980’s, this detached family house does now require a sympathetic programme of restoration and reorganisation, but could provide a stunning individual property set in a wonderfully mature ¼ acre garden.

A substantial semi-detached Edwardian house offering bright, spacious and beautifully proportioned accommodation which retains much of the original character. Still offering significant potential, this spacious property has off road parking for two cars and is only a short walk to local amenities.

Quietly tucked away at the end of this private road, a classic hidden gem, beautifully presented whilst retaining a wealth of character and boasting a pretty south facing garden. Affording five double bedrooms and three bath/shower rooms, ‘Forest Ferns’ is deceptively spacious and internal inspection is imperative.

Built some 15 years ago to an exacting standard, this modern Regency style end terrace town house offers beautifully proportioned accommodation in a convenient and central location close to the town centre.

A deceptively spacious detached village property in the highly sought after parish of Prestbury. Offering four double bedrooms and the potential to extend, The Folly was built in c.1986 and backs onto beautiful open countryside and would now warrant a general programme of refurbishment.

Quietly tucked away in its own private enclave at the foot of Leckhampton Hill, this individual detached four bedroom single storey dwelling has been completely refurbished to an exceptionally high standard by the present owners.

A rare opportunity to create an exciting conversion of an historic Grade II Listed former church, in an outstanding location on the middle slopes of Cleeve Hill, occupying a generous 0.7acre (approx.) plot which enjoys stunning views across the Severn Vale. The property has consent for the conversion into a residential dwelling and planning consent has been granted for a contemporary extension.

In what is without doubt one of the town’s finest locations, this substantial 1930’s detached family home is hidden away behind mature trees in a generous plot and offers beautifully proportioned and elegant accommodation.
Located in the popular Montpellier district this is a classic Georgian town house, Listed Grade II. Offered in impeccable order, boasting a wealth of character and benefiting from off road parking.
